title: Middlebury College Rugby Club
text:
Middlebury College Rugby Club is the Division II <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> team of <a href="Middlebury%20College">Middlebury College</a>, located in <a href="Middlebury%2C%20Vermont">Middlebury, Vermont</a>. Also known as The MCRC, the club competes in the <a href="New%20England%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">New England Rugby Football Union</a>.
Officers.
Coaches : Kerry Wiebe, Avisa (Junior) Tuiqere, Ben Wells
Co-Captain : Red Douoguih '2023.5
Co-Captain : Mathew Dulaney '2022
President : Griffin Shapiro '2022
Treasurer : Samuel Sullivan '2022.5
Match Secretary : Will Ebby '2022
D II National Champions.
On May 5, 2007, MCRC beat <a href="Arkansas%20State">Arkansas State</a> 38–22 to win the Division II National Championship for the first time in club history. MCRC won the National Championship again in 2009, beating <a href="University%20of%20Wisconsin">University of Wisconsin</a> 27-11 and finishing the season undefeated.
Titles.
East Coast Rugby Conference Division 1-AA Champions: 2012, 2013
National Division II Champions: 2007,2009
NERFU Division II Champions: 2001,2002,2003,2005,2006,2007,2008
Northeast Territorial Division II Champions: 2001,2002,2008
"The Blue".
"The Blue" originated in the spring of 2008 under coaches Kevin O'Brien and John Phillips. It is a recognition of players that played a minimum of 5 regular season or playoff games for the MCRC A-side. Members of The Blue are responsible for nominating the team's captains for the following season and receive their jersey upon graduation.
